result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Includes cases 22CF699, 20CM278, 20CM423, 20CM1407, 20CM1593, 20CM1594, 21CM86, and 21CM125. No contact with victim(s): S.Y. or their residence or Bull Falls Gazebo. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. If a GPS monitor is available through ATTIC, Defendant to be put on that monitor. No Fires. Prints and photos for all files.

Case Called: 11:08 am
INCLUDES 20CM278, 20CM423, 20CM1407, 20CM1593, 20CM1594, 21CM86, 21CM1252, 22CF699.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski in person. Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Jack Mathie in person.
VRCW.
Date and time set for a Competency Hearing/Bond Modification Hearing. 
Court addresses the parties; State has received a message that the Doctor is unable to testify at today's hearing.
Atty Mathie states that the Competency Hearing is contested; Atty Mathie objects to any continuance due to this case being rescheduled multiple times.
Atty Mathie is requesting to proceed with the bond motion today.
Atty Mathie makes bond arguments. ADA Vechinski objects to any bond modification and makes arguments. Rebuttal arguments made.
Court addresses the parties and makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: 
Amends Bond to a $400 Signature Bond with the Same Conditions on 22CF699.
Defendant must Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. 
- If a GPS monitor is available through ATTIC, Defendant to be put on that monitor. 

DATES: Competency Hearing to be rescheduled with the Judicial Assistant.

Case Called: 10:53 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Davis Runde in person. Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty Jack Mathie in person.
VRCW. 
Date and time set to address the Defendant's Motion to Dismiss. 
Atty Mathie states that he does intend to raise Competency on Defendant and makes statements. 
State makes arguments on Motion. Rebuttal arguments made. 
Court addresses the parties and makes findings.
Court Finds Probable Cause in this matter and Denies Motion to Dismiss.
Atty Mathie is requesting a Competency Examination to be done on Defendant.
COURT Orders that a Competency Exam to be completed on the Defendant by the Wisconsin Forensics Unit - Report to be filed within 15 Days.
